intro: Plectritis microptera, commonly known as the small-leaved pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Plectritis microptera is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
